description: Singapore’s ruling party recruited a younger, more female slate of candidates ahead of the May 3 election in a bid to connect with a changing electorate, but across the political spectrum, efforts to showcase diversity only go so far.
title: Singapore Ruling Party Selects Record Number of Women for Poll

description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth, facing criticism of his stewardship at the Pentagon and beset by staff turnover, added a member of Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency to his circle of close advisers.
title: Hegseth Taps DOGE Staffer as Senior Adviser After Staff Exodus

description: Republican members of the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee are preparing a $15 billion package to revamp the country’s aging air-traffic control system, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: GOP Lawmakers Ready $15 Billion Plan to Fix Air Traffic Control

description: Citadel founder Ken Griffin extended his criticism of the Trump administration’s trade policy, saying that tariffs won’t bring back American manufacturing jobs the way that the president anticipates and the country should play to its strengths instead.
title: Ken Griffin Criticizes Trump Tariffs: ‘These Jobs Are Not Coming Back’

description: Federal law enforcement agents can arrest Venezuelan nationals in the US suspected of belonging to the Tren de Aragua gang without a judicial or administrative warrants, according to a directive from Attorney General Pam Bondi.
title: US Agents Cleared for Warrantless Arrest of Alleged Gang Members

description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Organizers and the Kennedy Center have canceled a week’s worth of events celebrating LGBTQ+ rights for this summer’s World Pride festival in Washington, D.C., amid a shift in priorities and the ousting of leadership at one of the nation’s premier cultural institutions.
title: Kennedy Center Cancels  LGBTQ+ Pride Celebration Planned for June

description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell used a gathering of finance chiefs from around the world to stress that central banks must be shielded from politics to ensure they can focus on keeping inflation stable and employment high, according to people who listened to his remarks.
title: Powell Draws Applause on Independence at Closed-Door IMF Meeting

description: President Donald Trump’s administration has drafted a framework to handle negotiations with trading partners rushing to secure deals to avert tariff hikes, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US Officials Adopt ‘Organized’ Framework to Handle Trade Talks

description: Malaysia’s initial meeting with US officials on tariffs went well but it’s only the first step toward forging a trade agreement, according to a top economic official from the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Malaysia-US Trade Talks Started ‘Well Enough,’ Official Says

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Catherine Lucey looks ahead to the president’s trip to Rome for the pope’s funeral. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Presence Turns Pope’s Funeral Into a Stage for Diplomacy

description: Rwanda and Democratic Republic of Congo committed to drafting a peace agreement aimed at ending decades of conflict between the two countries in a ceremony at the US State Department Friday.
title: Rubio Prods Congo, Rwanda to Make Peace as Duo Agree to Deadline

description: President Donald Trump’s administration is launching an investigation into the University of California, Berkeley, claiming the school’s disclosures over foreign funding “may be incomplete or inaccurate.”
title: Trump Launches Probe Into UC Berkeley Over Foreign Funding

description: A group of 19 states sued to block the Trump administration from freezing federal funds for states that refuse to eliminate diversity, equity and inclusion programs in K-12 public schools.
title: States Sue to Block Trump Freezing K-12 School Funding Over DEI

description: The Department of Homeland Security has begun reinstating the records of international students whose termination from a federal database disrupted their employment and put their lawful status in doubt.
title: US Reverses Course on Terminating International Students’ Status

description: Treasuries rallied for a second week, all but erasing this month’s losses, amid signs the Trump administration is making efforts to deescalate trade tensions.
title: Treasuries Rally With Dollar on Signs of Easing Trade Tensions

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said Friday she held talks with US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent about an “economic prosperity deal” that will serve both countries’ “national interests.”
title: Reeves Says Deal Discussed With Bessent Will Serve Both UK, US

description: Suriname government official are meeting with the International Monetary Fund to discuss frameworks for a second program after a prior $688 million agreement expired in March, according to its finance minister.
title: Suriname Meets With IMF to Discuss Successor Program Before Vote

description: The UK government is preparing to announce a fresh deal with pension fund managers as soon as May 6, which could pour tens of billions of pounds into the country’s private markets.
title: Reeves Looks to Unveil Fresh UK Pension Funds Deal in Early May

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is promising a tax deferral for investors who put money into Canadian assets — a policy similar to a popular US rule that helped grease its housing market.
title: US Tax Rule Offers Template for Canadian Conservatives’ Investment Pitch

description: Canada’s next prime minister is set to inherit a half-year of flat economic growth, economists predict, an immediate test of their governance as President Donald Trump’s trade war grinds business investment and exports lower.
title: Canada’s Election Winner Faces Economy That’s Near Recession

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy acknowledged that Ukrainian forces would be unable to regain control over Crimea and said the US won’t have to commit troops as part of security guarantees in an apparent overture to President Donald Trump.
title: Zelenskiy Says Kyiv Can’t Take Back Crimea Now in Nod to Trump

description: The funeral for Pope Francis was intended to be a stripped down affair to honor the simplicity of the man. Instead the attendance of US President Donald Trump has turned it into a high-profile stage for international diplomacy at a moment of geopolitical turmoil.
title: A Simple Funeral for Pope Francis Becomes Conduit to See Trump

description: Former US Representative George Santos, a onetime rising Republican star who falsely claimed to have worked for Goldman Sachs Group Inc. before running for Congress, was ordered to serve seven years and three months in prison for stealing campaign funds.
title: George Santos Gets Seven Years for Stealing Campaign Funds

description: A state judge in Wisconsin was arrested Friday by federal agents after an investigation into whether she obstructed an immigration arrest last week.
title: Wisconsin Judge Arrested in Obstruction Probe Over Immigration

description: Within 48 hours of a deadly attack on tourists in Kashmir, India had downgraded diplomatic ties with its neighbor Pakistan and vowed to suspend a crucial water-sharing treaty, while Pakistan had banned Indian planes from its airspace and halted cross-border trade.
title: Why are India and Pakistan Always at Odds?

description: China will adopt new policy support for the economy to counter external shocks if needed, central bank governor Pan Gongsheng said, in line with top officials’ latest signals of taking a patient approach to supporting growth.
title: PBOC’s Pan Pledges More Steps to Address Tariff Shock If Needed

description: Track Canada's electoral seats, districts, and key battlegrounds in real time
title: Canada Election Live Results 2025

description: Kyiv detained a ship it says was part of Moscow’s “shadow fleet” which illegally exports grain from areas of Ukraine occupied by Russian forces.
title: Ukraine Says It Detained Grain Ship From Russia’s ‘Shadow Fleet’

description: President Donald Trump’s pick to take the lead on US sanctions strategy warned of “consequences” for any nation that imports Venezuelan oil, signaling a tough line against Nicolas Maduro’s regime and potential repercussions for China.
title: Trump Sanctions Chief Pick Warns ‘Consequences’ on Venezuela Oil

description: The deportation of dozens of international students from Yale University and other Connecticut colleges was temporarily blocked by a federal judge.
title: Yale, UConn Students’ Deportations Temporarily Blocked by Judge

description: Congress will likely exert more authority over US trade policy if the White House doesn’t demonstrate “significant progress” in the ongoing tariff negotiations with dozens of countries in the coming weeks, New York Republican Representative Mike Lawler says.
title: Congress Should Intervene If Trump Trade War Drags, Lawler Says

description: Gabon’s top court said military leader Brice Oligui Nguema won the country’s first elections since he overthrew the government almost two years ago.
title: Gabon’s Top Court Affirms Junta Leader Nguema’s Election Win

description: The International Monetary Fund warned Europe not to obstruct change as it attempts to alleviate the fallout from US President Donald Trump’s tariff torrent.
title: IMF Warns Europe Not to Block ‘Inevitable Structural Change’

description: The upstart Reform UK party has emerged as a serious contender in British politics.
title: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK Party Is on the Rise. Here’s What It Stands For

description: The world economy is at a “pivotal juncture” as trade tensions flare, members of the International Monetary Fund said in a draft statement after a week of discussions that have been overshadowed by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.
title: IMF Members See World at ‘Pivotal Juncture’ Amid Trade Wars

description: The European Union next week will consider potential changes to its 15% minimum corporate tax law in a bid to ease tensions with the US.
title: EU to Consider Changing Its Minimum Tax Law to Quell US Tensions

description: The Danish defense intelligence service said Russia sought to stir up tensions between the US and Denmark by spreading fake news about Greenland earlier this year.
title: Denmark Blames Russia for False Greenland News to Stoke US Spat

description: Harold Hamm, a shale billionaire and significant donor to President Donald Trump, said his company Continental Resources is committing to only buy oilfield equipment made in the US — even if it costs more.
title: One of Trump’s Biggest Oil Donors Vows to Only Buy US-Made Gear

description: President Donald Trump said he would “absolutely” sign a bill banning congressional stock trading, saying he was concerned lawmakers could be using insider information for an advantage.
title: Trump Says He Would Sign Bill Banning Congressional Stock Trades

description: US President Donald Trump said that he did not envision Ukraine joining NATO in the future, reiterating his administration’s stance that Kyiv relinquish its hopes of joining the military alliance.
title: Trump Doesn’t Think Ukraine Will ‘Ever Be Able to Join NATO’

description: President Donald Trump said he would not sign legislation that calls for cuts to Social Security or federal health coverage for older and low-income Americans.
title: Trump Says He Would Veto Cuts to Medicaid, Social Security

description: President Donald Trump said he expected to wrap up trade deals with US partners looking for lower tariffs soon.
title: Trump Sees Trade Deals Coming in Three to Four Weeks

description: The leader of South Africa’s Democratic Alliance said his party remains committed to being part of the nation’s coalition government despite ongoing wrangling over key policies and legislation, and has no intention of walking away.
title: South Africa’s Second-Biggest Party Rules Out Quitting Coalition

description: President Donald Trump said he is open to the idea of higher taxes on millionaires — an idea that is being hotly debated in Republican circles — but said he worries that a levy increase could hurt the party.
title: Trump Says He Loves Millionaire Tax, Worries of Political Risk

description: President Donald Trump misjudged Beijing by calculating that it would cave into economic pressure, leaving the US unprepared to handle the current tariff standoff, according to an adviser to China’s Foreign Ministry.
title: Trump ‘Misjudged’ China on Trade War, Diplomatic Adviser Says

description: The United Nations called for a cessation of hostilities between the army and fighters loyal to South Sudan’s deputy president to prevent a “fragile” security situation deteriorating further in the oil-producing nation.
title: UN Urges Ceasefire as Fighting Flares Between South Sudan Rivals

description: India and Pakistan troops exchanged fire in the Jammu and Kashmir region on Friday, according to officials in New Delhi, as relations between the nuclear-armed neighbors continue to plummet after a deadly attack on tourists this week.
title: India Says Troops Exchanged Fire With Pakistan Army in Kashmir

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Jr. Embarks on a Balkan Business Odyssey

description: Brazil’s former President Fernando Collor de Mello is set to begin serving a prison sentence over a conviction on corruption and money laundering charges.
title: Brazil Ex-President Collor Arrested After Corruption Conviction

description: US President Donald Trump’s special envoy arrived in Moscow, according to the Interfax news service, as Washington intensifies its push for a deal to end Russia’s war on Ukraine.
title: Trump Envoy Witkoff Arrives in Moscow, Interfax Reports

description: Indonesia is considering exporting rice, a rare phenomenon for a country that often imports itself, in a bid to bolster goodwill with nations in need of the staple grain.
title: Indonesia Mulls Rare Rice Exports in Bid to Boost Ties Abroad

description: A US-India trade agreement under discussion will cover 19 categories, including greater market access for farm goods, e-commerce, data storage and critical minerals, people familiar with the matter said, the first step toward a deal that may help the South Asian nation evade higher tariffs on its goods.
title: US Seeks India Trade Deal on E-Commerce, Crops and Data Storage

description: The new management of the Hungarian central bank’s foundation, appointed by recently installed Governor Mihaly Varga, has pressed charges on suspected fraud and misappropriation under the previous leadership, Index reported, citing people familiar with the matter it didn’t name.
title: Hungary Central Bank Alleges Fraud at Its Foundation, Index Says

description: Thailand needs to revamp its import regulations and investment promotion policies — key drivers for Chinese capital flows into the Southeast Asian nation in recent years — as a hefty US tariff threatens to hurt the nation’s export-driven growth, according to former leader Thaksin Shinawatra.
title: Thaksin Signals Thai Policy Reset to Cut Deal With US on Tariffs

description: China vowed to “fully prepare” emergency plans to ward against increasing external shocks, as a deepening trade war with Donald Trump piles pressure on the world’s No. 2 economy.
title: China Vows to Ready Emergency Plan, Policy Tools Amid Trade War

description: Zimbabwe has asked some of the world’s richest nations for bridge finance to end a debt standoff dating back to 1999, people with direct knowledge of the matter said.
title: Zimbabwe Asks Rich Nations to Help Scale $21 Billion Debt Hurdle

description: The frontrunner in South Korea’s presidential race, Lee Jae-myung, aims to prioritize trade talks with the US and the compilation of another extra budget to shore up Asia’s fourth-largest economy if he wins the June 3 election.
title: South Korea’s Lead Presidential Candidate Eyes Trade, Pragmatism

description: The Philippines will offer to purchase more farm products from the US as it pushes to reduce a 17% tariff rate imposed on the Southeast Asian nation’s goods, according to Trade Secretary Cristina Roque.
title: Philippines Eyes More US Imports in Bid to Lower US Tariff

description: Lawyers for Columbia University activist Mahmoud Khalil say they will argue that his deportation should be blocked after the Trump administration acknowledged he was arrested without a warrant.
title: Detained Columbia Student’s Lawyers Decry Warrantless Arrest

description: Chinese leaders are likely to signal a resolve to defend growth at a key economic policy meeting, analysts say, after Beijing defied US President Donald Trump’s pressure to jump into tariff negotiations.
title: Politburo to Shed Light on Xi’s Plans for Trade War Stimulus

description: China, the world’s dominant plastics producer, could exempt imports of petrochemical feedstocks ethane and liquefied petroleum gas from tariffs should talks with the US prove positive, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said.
title: China May Exempt Ethane and LPG From Hefty Tariffs, Goldman Says

description: Australia’s political leaders condemned a group suspected of being led by a convicted neo-Nazi for heckling at a national memorial service for the country’s soldiers.
title: Australian Leaders Blast Neo-Nazi Hecklers at War Memorial Event

description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra was hospitalized late on Thursday due to high fever, according to government spokesman Jirayu Houngsub.
title: Thai PM Hospitalized for Fever; Cancels Friday’s Engagements
